website_summaries.verdict: A book with a dizzying array of easy-to-make recipes that also helps readers to avoid gluten and other common allergies as you learn to make these delectable gluten-free foods.
pros: Includes slow cooker, 30 minute, and Instant Pot meals
Examples include honey mustard sheet-pad salmon, crispy waffles, and French toast
cons: Only available in hardcover right now

customer_reviews.title: For the astute health food person.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a gift but I am not going to give it as planned. Recipes are long, ingredients are not easily accessible.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya

customer_reviews.title: BEST ONE YET!!
customer_reviews.text: Danielle Walker was literally the person who made me step into the realm of paleo and never look back! I have many health issues and all of her cookbooks have endless recipes that make you miss NOTHING while becoming paleo. This book is her best one yet! I literally want to make EVERY SINGLE RECIPE! Amazing! Number one cookbook I would recommend to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Jodi Ann Johannes

customer_reviews.title: My kids get to enjoy all the foods!
customer_reviews.text: Danielle Walker has changed our families lives because of her recipes. She works so hard to develop recipes that taste like the real deal. They aren't hard to make just might have a few extra steps but I am ok with that if I am able to give my kids the foods their friends have only healthier! I love all of her books. I volunteered to be a recipe tester for this book. I made the Snickerdoodles, Sun Butter Crunch Bars, Beef with Broccoli, Acai Berry-Chia Pudding Parfaits, Chocolate Donuts, and the Fish Sticks and Naan. As always with any of Danielle's books, you will not be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Nikkie Hancock

customer_reviews.title: A Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: First recipe I tried: lunchbox sandwich bread. There has to be a typo in there somewhere. 3/4 cup of coconut flour and two cups of arrowroot flour with minimal liquid? I questioned this, as I do know how coconut flour behaves. My “batter” came out like cornmeal. Had to put it in the blender and add a ton of liquid. There is no way that this recipe is correct. These recipes cost a lot of money to make, so typos with ingredients is a little hard to take. I do like the author and admire her work, but this was a big disappointment. Returning it today.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Amazon

customer_reviews.title: You NEED this cookbook!!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a huge Danielle Walker fan! I had to go paleo because I suffer from an autoimmune disorder, and I won’t lie, I thought it would be awful. I found her website against all grain and immediately purchased the celebrations cookbook, which I LOVE also! Since I recieved my “Eat what you love” book, I’ve made quite a few recipes, all fantastic! Even my husband and 5 young children have jumped on board with the paleo lifestyle, and that’s huge. I highly recommend. Recipes are delicious, and eating this way has changed how I feel completely.
customer_reviews.author: MomOfSix

customer_reviews.title: Repeat recipes, lots of junk food
customer_reviews.text: There are too many junk food recipes and a lot of repeat recipes from her blog and other books. The only reason it doesn’t get 1 star is because several dinner recipes are pretty delicious and the photography is beautiful. Unfortunately, the book contains mostly sugary junk/snack food recipes. Just because something is gluten free or dairy free does not mean it is heathy.
customer_reviews.author: M. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Long & Complicated Recipies
customer_reviews.text: While I love all of the pictures, the recipes are complicated and call for numerous ingredients that aren’t kitchen staples. Do not buy this book if you are looking for quick & easy weeknight meals. This book should come with a warning stating this book is only for those with time & money to burn.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Not healthy. Very carb and sugar heavy = inflammation
customer_reviews.text: We have all of her cookbooks. This was disappointing. Beautiful photos, but so many carb heavy recipes. Waiting for people to realize just how inflammatory some of these replacement flours are (cassava!!!). This really isn’t paleo. This is the American diet taking over paleo. It’s just not healthy.
customer_reviews.author: melissa hinds

customer_reviews.title: Amazing cookbook
customer_reviews.text: Another book, another masterpiece! I now own all 4 of Danielle Walker’s cookbooks and each is individually amazing. Eat What You Love has sooooo many recipes for foods you may miss on a grain free diet, but can now create with this book! I am so excited to start making things and enjoying the food! The pictures are gorgeous! She also has a meal prep plan too which is helpful. Purchase this book, you won’t regret it!!
customer_reviews.author: Brian & Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Lovely in every way
customer_reviews.text: I’m so thankful for all of the work Danielle puts into her cookbooks. Facing a diagnosis of autoimmune disease and then facing the difficulties of finding ways to counter it have been a daunting task. She has put together recipes that are doable (some contain a lot of ingredients but that’s where you get the flavor and similarity to their non-paleo dishes) and makes it easy to plan ahead. The photos are beautiful and I appreciate how the majority of the photos are of the actual recipes. I own all of her books but this one is easily my favorite so far!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Cookbook... again!
customer_reviews.text: Danielle Walker has given the allergy community yet another amazing cookbook! Her recipes help recreate the feelings of childhood meals but so much healthier! Every recipe I have tried so far has been amazing and the directions are easy to follow.
customer_reviews.author: Carter Fox

customer_reviews.title: Not paleo centric
customer_reviews.text: The recipes in this book are great and offer some fantastic sounding dishes but this should not be marketed as a paleo cook book. Almost every recipe in this book has a reference to a complex dairy free or grain free ingredient. I was looking for a cookbook that was actually paleo friendly and not about finding a way to replace grain or dairy in a dish. Will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: SBooze

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful book, best one yet from the author
customer_reviews.text: What a wonderful thing to be able to make food that replaces old familiar favorites with new, healthier ones. There are lots of options for different dietary restrictions and it’s easy to find the different recipes because of the various references in the back. I love how the book is layed out! Also, the quality of the book material is so nice! If you haven’t seen her other books or blog, you should know that Danielle Walker is a food wizard! Nearly every recipe I have tried has been delicious and turned out well.
customer_reviews.author: C. Del Valle

customer_reviews.title: Mainly lunch and snack items.
customer_reviews.text: I have another of her books which I love but this one may be geared more for moms making paleo snacks and lunches for their kids. There's bread, bagels, sandwiches, pizza pockets, pop tarts. Not as many dinner options as I had hoped. It's a beautiful book if you are a collector but just not what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy this book and make all the things.
customer_reviews.text: All of Danielle's cookbooks are winners. We're a Celiac household and there are foods my kids have never tried because I've never attempted to find gluten-free recipes, or because it just hasn't been worth it to substitute junk food with other junk food. Every recipe we've tried so far from this cook book has been so good we've made it multiple times already. My son is so inspired by Danielle and her work he likes to draw his own cookbooks with himself on the cover. Praise doesn't get much better than that, does it?
customer_reviews.author: MKB

customer_reviews.title: My favorite Danielle Walker cookbook yet!
customer_reviews.text: I have all of Danielle Walker's cookbooks but this is my favorite so far (Celebrations was almost a tie). This had more of the foods in it that our family "gave up" when we went gluten/grain free (The Chicken & Dumplings are incredible!). The pictures are stunning, the cooking instructions are crystal clear, she offers info on substitutions and variations to recipes to accommodate different diets where applicable and everything we have made has come out 5 stars! She also gives enough info in the front of the book for those of you that are not seasoned paleo chef's and there are no crazy hard to find ingredients needed. Buy this!
customer_reviews.author: M.E.K.

customer_reviews.title: Too much prep time.
customer_reviews.text: Too many obscure ingredients and WAY too much prep time!
customer_reviews.author: C.P.

customer_reviews.title: Thank you Danielle!!
customer_reviews.text: Due to health issues I have to revamp my diet and this book is so worth the purchase. But i should also note I do have all the other cookbooks Danielle has published... so I might be bias. I know I have seen people say you can find a lot of the recipes online (I haven't looked and compared) but personally I don't care I prefer to have Danielle's exact recipe versus possible copycat recipes online. I like the fact she has tested these recipes with different products and she provides you the best products use for the best chance at success (I say that cause I am new to cooking in general, let alone dairy free and gluten free)
customer_reviews.author: D. Vincent

customer_reviews.title: GREAT COOKBOOK
customer_reviews.text: I was new to the gluten free lifestyle and had no idea where to start. Danielle's book have been amazing! I was so excited when I received this book. She has lot of childhood recipes that I thought I would never be able to eat again. I love her homemade chicken nuggets (my family who isn't gluten free will eat these over regular chicken nuggets from the store), cookies, AAGwiches, breads and so much more!!! She has opened up a whole new avenue for me with food and I'm so grateful. I've even started playing with my one family recipes based on what I've learned from her books! She is incredible and her story is so inspiring!
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Obsessed!!! Amazing and delicious recipes!
customer_reviews.text: Wow!! I’ve never been this bonkers over a cookbook before! For starts, it’s beautifully done! The cover is durable and the photos are beautiful. The recipes are very easy to follow and insanely delicious. I’ve made only a handful of recipes but they’ve all turned out so good. And those chocolate donuts...!!!! Gosh. Amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Felishia Rae

customer_reviews.title: The best!
customer_reviews.text: I have huge collection of cookbooks! Every recipe I have tried is delicious!!! This is great book for a lot of comfort foods or foods you are used to buying “premise” like animal crackers, muffins sauces etc. The chicken nuggets are amazing! Seriously, the best paleo cookbook! Beautiful pictures. Very informative too, with hints and reheating options. This has changed me from being frustrated to knowing recipes are good and doable. Granted, recipes do take some time. Maybe not for the person that wants to quick make something...
customer_reviews.author: Sandra W

customer_reviews.title: I have not been disappointed with any of Danielle Walker's recipes!
customer_reviews.text: I consider myself an average eater...somewhat picky, but not terribly picky. I have been gluten free for nine years, but recently have gone grain and dairy free as well due to some digestion issues. I have Chron's disease and colitis, and although medication is necessary the rest of my life, eating grain/dairy and gluten free has changed how I feel and provided a LOT more energy. I am not a very adventurous or talented cook, but her recipes are easy to follow and have tasted amazing. I highly recommend her books.
customer_reviews.author: Andi

customer_reviews.title: Love the kid friendly options
customer_reviews.text: Love this book and te kid friendly options it has such a chicken nuggets, cookies, hot pockets, etc. love the make ahead and freeze section since that is what I do for most of my paleo foods. My son has autoimmune issues and it nice to have a cookbook that lets him have options that other kids his age get to eat. The recipes are elaborate and time consuming, but that is why I like that she talks about how to store and freeze/reheat options. That is just part of whole food cooking and paleo diet.
customer_reviews.author: DL

customer_reviews.title: You won’t regret it
customer_reviews.text: Danielle walkers books and recipes are truly amazing. They are easy to follow and soo sooo good. I am not a veggie person and prior to 3 months ago was a processed food junky. Having some gut issues and general fatigue as well as excess baby weight I borrowed a lot of books from library all on gut health. Hers were my favorites and so I bought to have all the time. You won’t be disappointed. Still relearning how to cook Paleo and had to buy a lot of ingredients I’ve never used before but now 3 months in the kids and I have some favorite go to recipes. Can’t wait to try more.
customer_reviews.author: Mjonesy

customer_reviews.title: Tasteful
customer_reviews.text: I don’t have any diet restrictions, though this book is great for those that do. I just genuinely love eating better. I have purchased all of her books and have made so many recipes and all of them where well executed and very tasty. This book is probably my favorite of all though. Well balanced it the likely hood of me making the recipes. My only criticism is I wish the ingredient list was in order of use. I love cook books that list the ingredients based on the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: ray jobi

customer_reviews.title: I’d give it 10 stars if I could!
customer_reviews.text: This cookbook is amazing!! I have a kid who rides the spectrum and struggles with sensory issues with food. He is a carb eater which, as other sensory mamas know, can lead to digestive struggles. He has loved literally every thing I’ve made from this book! It’s opened up so many more options for us. The banana bread, for example, is now a staple around here. I am so thankful to have found this and need all of her other books!
customer_reviews.author: BigMamaD

customer_reviews.title: Great Resource
customer_reviews.text: Whether it's this cookbook, her others, Instagram or her blog, Danielle Walker is a great resource for those wanting to eat clean in order to heal their bodies. I have an autoimmune disorder so I'm always looking for recipes that may lessen inflammation. Danielle's recipes have been great. I also love how willing Danielle is to share her personal story... It may not impact the quality of the recipes but it helps to know that someone is fighting right alongside us.
customer_reviews.author: E. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Life changing cookbook!
customer_reviews.text: Danielle Walker’s cookbooks have improved my daughters quality of life 10 fold. We found her through a friend nearly two years ago after my teenage daughter was diagnosed with Crohn’s disease. I read Danielle’s story and decided to give the paleo diet a chance. With a few months my daughter was feeling significantly better and soon was in remission. 16 months later and she feels like her old self and is symptom free with only the slightest bit of mild occasional discomfort. We have every one of her cookbooks and we have found several recipes that the entire family loves! So yes, we totally recommend this cookbook. Along with all the rest of her books.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Howell

customer_reviews.title: Comfort favorites are back in our life!
customer_reviews.text: Diagnosed as Celiac last spring, I've been cooking out of Danielle's other three cookbooks since March. My family doesn't have too many complaints but has missed some of our "old favourites". THANK YOU DANIELLE for bringing chicken pot pie, chicken and dumplings, morning glory muffins and more back into our lives! We enjoyed the BEST chicken caesar salad I've ever had last night. 😍 HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!
customer_reviews.author: L. P. Kirker

customer_reviews.title: Delicious Food Without restrictions
customer_reviews.text: For those of us who have dietary restrictions, it often seems like we are limited to our options for food choices. With Eat What You Love, Danielle gives us delicious versions of foods we love without any of the ingredients we cannot have. Some of my favorites so far are the dill chicken salad and cauliflower hummus. They are easy to make for everyday and every bit as delicious as the traditional versions. I also love the banana bread. I have served this to friends who had no idea it was gluten free and dairy free. It also freezes and reheats beautifully. I highly recommend you get this cookbook.
customer_reviews.author: KW

customer_reviews.title: Yum and fun!
customer_reviews.text: If you have had the opportunity to reassess your diet and have missed some comfort staples, try this cookbook! Comfort foods from corn dogs to nilla style wafers- and plenty of other yummy foods you thought were part of your old life! Luckily old eating habits may have had to die for the fun rebirth this cookbook holds. Eat the Southern style biscuits complete with gravy then munch on naan bread as you wait for your Bollywood Pride and Prejudice to start.... its all good and your gut won’t want to kill you later!!!
customer_reviews.author: jeffrey gillis

customer_reviews.title: this is my 4th cookbook of hers
customer_reviews.text: She does it again!! I have all of Danielle's cookbooks and every recipe I make is guaranteed to be delicious and easy to follow. This cookbook is filled with old childhood favorite recipes that we may not eat anymore due to the unhealthy ingredients. I made Danielle's jambalaya the other day - OMG so yummy!!! I recommend ANY of her cookbooks - if you are just starting out check out Meals Made Simple first.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great recipes - maybe not the top choice of her books if you can't tolerate arrowroot
customer_reviews.text: I love all of Danielle's cookbooks and 95% of what I make comes from them. However, this one isn't my favorite, only because my son can't tolerate tomatoes or arrowroot, and those are used in a lot of the recipes. There are some sub ideas for arrowroot, but I don't think they would work from the recipes that call for a large amount. I'm still loving what I can make from them, but find that we can make more of the recipes from her first books, especially Meals Made Simple. If you can eat arrowroot and tomato, then I think you will really enjoy the book!
customer_reviews.author: Krista

customer_reviews.title: Great so far!
customer_reviews.text: Just got this book & the first recipe I decided to make was cowboy cookies. They were and are delicious, but looked like spread out versions of the actual photo of the cookies in her book. Judging from photos from customers on here- I clearly did something wrong. :) Anynow- they taste great! I thought they would have an overwhelm coconut taste, but nope. Perfection.
customer_reviews.author: paperandiTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: She did it again
customer_reviews.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE. Just buy it. If you are even thinking of being GF or are told worse you must be GF and Grain free, DWNis terrific. I have already made a series of recipes and they are tasty and easy. My 3 year old even had a 100% nut granola bar and finished with YUMMY MOMMY!
customer_reviews.author: HH

customer_reviews.title: Love all of Danielle's cookbooks
customer_reviews.text: I love a beautiful cookbook. When we switched to paleo a couple of years ago I really missed having beautiful cookbooks with delicious food to cook from. Danielle has done it again with Eat What you Love. Her cookbooks are always beautiful and her recipes are delish and easy to make. I have all 4 of her cookbooks and can't wait to see what she will come up with next.
customer_reviews.author: LIM

customer_reviews.title: Good Gluten free, Dairy free, Paleo Recipes
customer_reviews.text: I have all four of her cookbooks. This one is really good for people who have to watch very carefully what they eat, regarding nut free, egg free etc. I don't have to be that careful. I think her first book is by far my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Bookloving Grandma

customer_reviews.title: Love all the recipes!
customer_reviews.text: Most cookbooks I look at I only see a few recipes that interest me. But this one I want to make everything in it. All the stuff I have made so far has been so yummy! I recently switched to a strict grain-free diet to help my digestive issues. I have noticed a huge difference in this diet. It's amazing. I feel so much better. Thank you, Danielle, for making these delicious recipes. I love that I can be on a diet but still eat my favorite comfort foods!
customer_reviews.author: Janine

customer_reviews.title: The Best book on the market
customer_reviews.text: Love the book , just have a Q about Sandwich rolls on page 317 where it says 3 cups whole raw cashews (see Tidbits, page 310) and on the page 310 cashew milk recipe only, please need help with what should I use MILK or FLOUR ??? Thank you. I am baking now and very happy with the book and recipes.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: A beautiful cookbook full of delicious and tasty recipes!
customer_reviews.text: This is such a beautiful cookbook full of delicious grain-free and dairy free recipes. My 7 year old loves the Acai chia parfaits and we tried the biscuits today and they turned out it great. Danielle Walker’s books are definitely my go-to for healthy delicious recipes for my family!
customer_reviews.author: Lyndsey808

customer_reviews.title: Delicious Recipes for the whole family - tree nut free friendly
customer_reviews.text: I have all 4 of Danielle Walker's cookbooks. This book is one of our absolute favorites. The recipes are delicious, easy to make, and include nut free versions - which is extremely important for our family with tree nut, wheat, soy, etc. allergies. I have yet to make a recipe from this book that we didn't like. Especially helpful is the substitution chart for different flours/liquids in the beginning - i.e. - substitution for almond flour. We have tree nut allergies - so several recipes we wouldn't be able to make without the chart. Recipes turned out great even with the substitution flours. Highly recommend this cookbook.
customer_reviews.author: JRS

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised and highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: My son wanted a cookbook that was gluten and dairy free. The first recipes we tried, Broccoli Beef and steak fajitas were a big hit in our family with people who have allergies and those who don’t. No one felt deprived. I was surprised how good the food tasted. I was skeptical that allergen free food could taste good.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Silverman

customer_reviews.title: This cookbook is amazing
customer_reviews.text: I love Danielle Walker’s cookbooks, this is the third one I own. I am so excited to make all of the recipes in here and I love the build a better lunch part. That’s something I really struggle with and it’s so helpful. I have a lot of allergies and food sensitivities and this book is perfect for my home. Now I have even more recipes that I know will be delicious and that I can enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Goyer

customer_reviews.title: She did it again!
customer_reviews.text: We love her cookbooks! The recipes are always easy to make and super tasty! And the recipes are things you would actually make and eat! Some cookbooks have recipes that you have to go and hunt for the ingredient, cause they are all unique and not something you'd have in your pantry.... But pretty much all her recipes call for things that are easy to get! We use it on a weekly to daily basis!
customer_reviews.author: Kafonino

customer_reviews.title: I got my family to eat chicken livers....and they never knew!
customer_reviews.text: I've only made 4 recipes from this book, but they are all winners. Usually my husband says "it's ok" for every dish I make but he pointedly asked for the Beef and Broccoli to be a regular. I also made the Pesto Power Meatballs, even with not enough pesto and my kids consumed them in the form of the Meatball sub and had no clue they were eating chicken livers! Our family also enjoyed the banana bread and acai berry chia pudding. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm so glad I found these cookbooks!
customer_reviews.text: Danielle Walker's cookbooks have been a game changer for me! I didn't know what was going on with my health and I was experimenting with different diets to see what would help. Going grain free has made a huge difference in my health. And bonus, the recipes are delicious! I love them!
customer_reviews.author: O Susannah

customer_reviews.title: Delicious Meals and Snacks!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my favorite cookbooks by Danielle. I own everyone of her cookbooks and while there are certainly recipes in each one that are to long and elaborate for a busy mom with baby but there are TONS I do love. Eat what you love is by far my favorite because it has so many options for switching out different flours. I’m gluten,almond and dairy intolerant, and I’m easily able to switch my dairy products but have a more difficult time finding a equal eqauation for flours as I can’t do almond flour. This book gives it ALL!! Thank you Danielle for being real and original! I love your work!
customer_reviews.author: User

customer_reviews.title: Our new go-to cookbook!
customer_reviews.text: Having to navigate multiple food allergies in our family felt so overwhelming years ago when we were diagnosed. Danielle Waller’s cookbooks have been life-savers! Her latest cookbook is our new go-to, especially the sheet pan meals which are now part of our weekly meal plan! The chicken parmesan dish was also huge hit! I’m looking forward to trying the onion rings as I’ve missed those! Thank you Danielle for helping me become a better cook and for helping me enjoy food again!
customer_reviews.author: M. King

customer_reviews.title: The best paleo cookbook ive found
customer_reviews.text: I love this cook book of danielle walkers just as much as her other ones! I use them weekly and our family meals pretty much all come out of her books. The broccoli beef, chili corn bread pie and chicken and dumplings are some of my favorites. I dont use ghee, but its pretty simple to use something else. Eating paleo is typically more work and has more ingredients, as with any healthy way of eating. But I have found it to be very easy and every meal is beyond delicious. I reccomend danielles cook books to everyone i know. She makes eating healthy easy and delicious!
customer_reviews.author: linds

customer_reviews.title: I’m happy with this cookbook!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this used and it was in excellent shape. Finally a great cookbook with food I can eat. So much variety, beautiful photos and well written recipes. I’ve purchased worse books for more money. I’m happy about this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Diart

customer_reviews.title: Total fan of her recipes
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th cookbook of Danielle’s, and each just keeps getting better and better! Grateful for her putting her heart into each of these recipes so that my family can enjoy all of the yummy creations without feeling the effects of the mainstream ingredients. Love that we don’t have to sacrifice taste in order to maintain a healthier lifestyle. It’s rare that a day goes by without one of her recipes (from books or blog) being made in our home.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea Rigel

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this cookbook. I have all 4 Danielle Walker cookbooks and this one absolutely does not disappoint. We have tried about 6 of the recipes so far, and love all of them! If my kids were writing this review, they would recommend the chocolate zucchini muffins. I do not normally write reviews, but this cookbook is a game changer when it comes to family paleo recipes!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Another amazing cookbook
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love her cookbooks. I own every single one and if you have any child or loved one with an allergy or food issue buy all of them. I use each for different things and this one is no exception. Everything I’ve ever made of hers is so delicious and it is designed with families in mind. Everything is delicious, beautiful and crowd pleasing! Oh, and healthy!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Love Danielle Walkers books
customer_reviews.text: This cook book arrived in poor condition, even though stated as new. The binding of the book holding the pages are falling apart.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I liked this cookbook. I own her other cookbooks on Kindle, but this was my first hard copy book from her. Pictures are beautiful! Recipes are awesome!! So many kid friendly recipes that I know my kids will love. Her banana bread recipe was awesome. Donuts, BAGELS... bread, crackers!! The list goes on and on. It seriously is filled with things we love!! Can’t wait to eat them!
customer_reviews.author: feather18

customer_reviews.title: Cooking for Crohns
customer_reviews.text: Danielle Walker is AMAZING. I have all four of her cookbooks and have my favorite recipes in each. Her story is inspiring and her recipes will give you hope that you do not have to sacrifice taste for health. Danielle and I are on a first name basis in my kitchen! :) I am truly so grateful for Danielle, her story, and her recipes as I navigate cooking healthy and nutritious meals for my husband who has Crohns.
customer_reviews.author: Julie D.

customer_reviews.title: Good but not essential
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful book of creative recipes. It is not my most reached for book as it doesn’t have a lot of meal concepts. The recipes here are mostly for snacks or treats
customer_reviews.author: Layla

customer_reviews.title: Hard to find ingredients
customer_reviews.text: I bought This for my mother in law who loves to eat unhealthy foods but is also trying to lose weight and be healthier. I feel Bad that I got It for her because she does not have access to most of the ingredients. She lives in a small town and I had No idea that so many of these ingredients were going to be specialty items that you can’t pick up at just any store . Also, I sent Danielle a message respectfully disagreeing with some irresponsible posts she made regarding race and she blocked me. Hard to support her books and such if your blocked and can’t see anything :).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Delicious Food for the Family
customer_reviews.text: I have all of Danielle's Cook Books. In her newest one, Eat What You Love, she includes lots of recipes for the Instant Pot. I had never cooked with a pressure cooker. Seeing her videos made me want to try it. All her recipes are a delight! Follow her blog too.
customer_reviews.author: Ginny Mapes

customer_reviews.title: She Is Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I have all of Danielle Walkers books. She is absolutely amazing and her recipes are so perfect! Because of her I was able to adjust to my new diet easily. Tried the ricotta cheesecake....it was superb!
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Not your usual ingredients
customer_reviews.text: This is a cookbook that will make me go out and buy stuff I have never bought before and perhaps have never eaten before. I need to get in a creative cooking mood before I try out some recipes. I heard about the cookbook from a YouTube homesteading family.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Grain Free Cookbook
customer_reviews.text: This book is amazing! It is the perfect paleo cookbook for families! I have all her books & they are all winners. You have to make the cowboy cookies, you won't miss the normal junk that's in regular cookies because these are so good!
customer_reviews.author: CHockey

customer_reviews.title: She’s the best!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has ulcerative colitis and I have GERD, IBS and gastritis. Cooking for us was a challenge until I discovered Danielle Walkers cookbooks a few years ago. Now I have all 4 of her cookbooks flagged with all of our favorite recipes.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Best Book Yet!
customer_reviews.text: We love Danielle Walker’s books! We’ve already made some of these recipes and they are amazing! I’m so happy that these recipes we’ve tried don’t take a super long time or bunch of dishes to make but are still paleo!
customer_reviews.author: Steph H.

customer_reviews.title: Another fabulous keeper!!
customer_reviews.text: I have all 4 of her books now and love them all. I can’t pick a favorite but this one may be it if I absolutely had to. The recipes are amazing. My whole family loves them and no one follows a special diet. It’s just delicious. I have made the sausage gravy and biscuits and apple crisp several times. They are fabulous. I can’t wait to try some others out!
customer_reviews.author: Kristen T.

customer_reviews.title: The best gluten free/paleo cookbook I own!
customer_reviews.text: Got Eat What You Alice as an early Christmas present and it was the best thing I used for Christmas dinner! I come from an Italian family who goes all out with food during the holidays, and I either feel left out of all the goodness I grew up on or I’m a hassle to cook for in the kitchen BUT not this year! I used the fried chicken recipe for fried shrimp and it was too good to be true! Some of my shrimp made its was to non Paleo eaters and they could not tell the difference!
customer_reviews.author: Hayden Dines

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous cookbook!
customer_reviews.text: Love Danielle’s new cookbook. So many delicious recipes for maintaining good health. She teaches in a joyful upbeat way. Her books are my only cookbooks and her recipes satisfy my family and friends too! I’ve handed them out for gifts and everyone raves over them. I’m grateful Danielle and I are on the same grain-free path and I can rely on her this way.
customer_reviews.author: Geege

customer_reviews.title: Another winner of a cookbook!
customer_reviews.text: Another great book from Danielle Walker! This cookbook is packed with recipes that look and taste amazing, easy to make, well written — a little something for everyone. Some of the recipes I have made so far from it are the sloppy joes, sheet pan salmon, beef & broccoli, and snickerdoodles. All were great and I will make them all again for my family of 7. I cannot wait to try the rest of the recipes!
customer_reviews.author: CindyK

customer_reviews.title: My favorite cookbook!
customer_reviews.text: I am a huge Danielle Walker and Against All Grain fan! I own all 4 of her books and this one only added to my love for her recipes! Everything I have ever tried of hers is amazing and my family, who doesn’t eat paleo, loves them too! I have auto immune issues that I manage with my diet and she brought back my love of cooking and baking with her cookbooks! Her recipes also brought back good family dinners to our family without having to make seperate recipes for my family and myself! You will not regret this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Deah Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Awesome recipes for food allergies
customer_reviews.text: I love this book because it is filled with wonderful, tasty recipes and can be adjusted to fit most food allergies. You will not regret buying this book - especially if you do all your cooking at home as I do.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Crisp

customer_reviews.title: So good! You will be delighted.
customer_reviews.text: My family enjoys every recipe we try from this cookbook! I can’t hardly wait to try more, except you want to keep making more of the ones you’ve already tried. Even my super selective husband likes every recipe. It’s full of real food you want your family to eat and I’ve become a better cook from all the instruction and information Danielle provides.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Adams

customer_reviews.title: No nutritional break out per serving
customer_reviews.text: I like that she has gluten free options. However, her recipes do not list calories/carbs/fat/protein. I am trying to track that for my diet. I wish I would have explored that before ordering.
customer_reviews.author: Stacie Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Another great cookbook!
customer_reviews.text: This is another homerun by Danielle Walker. This one actually might be my favorite. I love her little stories about each recipe, the pictures are lovely, and the layout of the recipes are easy to follow. Did I mention that they're super tasty, too?!?!
customer_reviews.author: mgsmiss

customer_reviews.title: Book #4 - they just keep getting better!
customer_reviews.text: Danielle Walker has changed the landscape of Paleo eating. She has made it exciting, approachable and always delicious. She’s a wife, a Mom and an entrepreneur who shows us that healthy eating is not only manageable, it’s delicious!
customer_reviews.author: K. Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Great recipes, even if you’re not grain free
customer_reviews.text: I have Danielle Walker’s first three cookbooks and was SO EXCITED to see this one released! It does not disappoint. It’s possible this one will be my favorite yet and that’s saying something. Yum! Also, I love that the book will open flat with just a little convincing. Her “healing chicken soup” is better than my own (that’s high praise) and I love the chicken salad too cooking our way through this whole book!
customer_reviews.author: Martha LaCroix

customer_reviews.title: High caloric content
customer_reviews.text: The ingredients in this cookbook are etremely expensive to purchase. Calorie content is not given. However just because it is gluten free doesnt mean the recipes are not high in calories they very much are. The recipes i tried were not very edible.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you can only get one of her books this is the one to get!!
customer_reviews.text: Danielle has 4 cook books out. I've have all 4 and been using her cook books since she released her first book. If you can only get one of her books this one is the one to get! Everything we have made is an explosion of flavors. I've made the dumpling soup and beef and broccoli twice now. My youngest LOVES the doughnuts. Danielle has a gift with her recipes!
customer_reviews.author: Brent Pendergrass

customer_reviews.title: Cookbook geared to healthy eating/cooking for people with food sensitivity issues.
customer_reviews.text: I let my daughter look at the cookbook and se loved it so I let her keep it and I bought another copy. I am dairy intolerant and this cookbook makes it easy to find recipes to meet my needs. Very satisfied with the cookbook.
customer_reviews.author: C. Talbott

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS BOOK!
customer_reviews.text: Danielle Walker never disappoints! I own all of her cookbooks and each one is better than the last. She makes it easy and possible to enjoy foods that are not usually gluten, dairy and grain free! She has made it easier for me to bring food to so many special occasions and make great date night meals as well! I truly cannot thank her enough and am forever grateful for finding her! BUY THIS BOOK!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love the recipes in this book (and all the other ones as well). They are delicious and family friendly. I’ve been following Danielle for years and was so excited to get the 4th of her cookbooks! It does not disappoint!
customer_reviews.author: Colette

customer_reviews.title: Danielle Walker does it again!
customer_reviews.text: Every recipe I have ever made from Danielle Walker has gotten rave reviews from my family. I never feel like I’m going without as every recipe has big, incredible flavor! We have recently had to go nut free and I love that there are several nut free recipes and also a flour conversion chart! Love that the book lays flat, has a page marker and it’s beautiful!
customer_reviews.author: Whitney

customer_reviews.title: Delicious, easy-to-follow recipes
customer_reviews.text: Every recipe in this book is delicious! The way this is written, every recipe is easy to follow and turns out great! I’ve bought all of her other books and this one does not disappoint
customer_reviews.author: AReyOfSunshine

customer_reviews.title: You can’t live without this cookbook in your life!
customer_reviews.text: Love this cookbook! I have 3 of the 4 Danielle Walker cookbooks and love every one of them. So far I have only tried the Baked Potatoe Soup and French Dip sandwiches but I’m so excited to try more. This cookbook will not disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: LindsayB

customer_reviews.title: Fool Proof and Great for Big Families
customer_reviews.text: I have all of Danielle's cookbooks. Her recipes are so full proof and this cookbook is no exception it is over the top good. I am enjoying cooking my way through it. We are a family of eight and I have been pleased with the quantity of the finished products. I don't feel like I need to double any recipes which is a lifesaver for me. Danielle, thank you (and your family) for the time you put into your recipes and the many resources you are willing to share.
customer_reviews.author: Mary K. Jasperson

customer_reviews.title: Super excited about this cookbook and I was not disappointed ...
customer_reviews.text: Super excited about this cookbook and I was not disappointed by the variety of foods. A bit of everything for everyone. I have a large family and they always eat her recipes, no complaints! Weekly meal suggestions included and my meals do actually end up looking like her photos!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda V

customer_reviews.title: Allergy friendly and delicious
customer_reviews.text: This book opens even more doors for those limited by health or food sensitivities/allergies. I have loved making each recipe for my family and they have been pleasantly surprised by how delcious they are. We have many left to cook but as usual I am not disappointed. So much thought went into the book layout and design as well to make user friendly. So thankful Danielle is continuing to experiment and create recipes that bring back all the memories of times before illness. ❤️
customer_reviews.author: Cerissa Frazier

customer_reviews.title: Twist on Traditional Recipes
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cookbook over a month ago and there are so many great recipes. The recipes are very flavorful and many have an unique twist on traditional recipes. Instead of chicken salad, there is a dill chicken salad. Instead of a dairy filled loaded potato soup, the author has a dairy free potato soup that uses white sweet potatoes! Some recipes have had their challenges in making because that's the reality with paleo baking. Paleo baking is finicky, but the author provides good tips to help.
customer_reviews.author: SSimmons

customer_reviews.title: Amazing and Delicious Recipes
customer_reviews.text: Danielle was the first Paleo cookbook author I followed when I switched to Paleo 6 years ago. Her first cookbook “Against All Grain” was the first Paleo cookbook I purchased. She has helped me so much with meal prepping and giving dairy free and gluten free, recipes that everyone can enjoy. She provides amazing recipes that are easy to follow and are so delicious! I recently made the chicken parm from”Eat What You Love” and it did not disappoint! I highly recommend “Eat What You Love”, along with her other cookbooks: “Againist All Grain”, “Meals Made Simple” and “Celebrations”. I own all 4 of her cookbooks and use her recipes regularly. Her cookbooks are game changers!
customer_reviews.author: Sonia M.

customer_reviews.title: Delicious!
customer_reviews.text: So far I LOVE this book! Made the Italian meatballs and they were amazing. Made the French Dip sandwiches in the IP - also amazing! I didn't make her rolls though I just bought udis. Excited to make more recipes. They aren't overly complicated or full of weird ingredients.
customer_reviews.author: tseymour

customer_reviews.title: Flavorful, satisfying and easy to make
customer_reviews.text: My family loves this cookbook! I got it for Christmas and every recipe I’ve made has been a hit. Today we made the Apple sauce and my kids kept asking for more. I plan to use many of the recipes for my upcoming whole30 and will make the paleo desserts after I finish whole30. All her cookbooks are amazing, I keep discovering recipes years into owning them.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: The complete cookbook
customer_reviews.text: I love, love, love this cookbook! Every recipe I have tried has been delicious and nutritious. The recipes are easy to follow and meal plans make eating healthy simple. This cookbook is a must have and it makes a great gift too.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen B.

customer_reviews.title: Cheese Crackers!
customer_reviews.text: So many tasty foods in here. I make the cheese crackers at least once a month. And the cowboy cookies are a hit! Plus great dinner ideas. As always, Danielles recipes are well tested and turn out delicious.
customer_reviews.author: erocha

customer_reviews.title: Great cookbook
customer_reviews.text: I was recently diagnosed with celiac disease and while I’m not cutting all the things Danielle does, it is so nice to have some ideas for other options that I could possibly have. This book is all inclusive and would be great for anyone with a food challenge!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Jardin

customer_reviews.title: Love every recipe we have made.
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful book. My family is on week 3 of her meal plan and every single recipe has been delicious. Tonight we had the butter chicken and naan and it didn’t even feel like we had lost any of the normal things like the dairy and white flour. I will say that the recipes have ingredients that were not staples for us, and are quite intense, but they have all been worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Charles H

customer_reviews.title: Great tasting healthy food
customer_reviews.text: You can feel good about any of these recipes no matter what your restrictions are ,there are tidbits to modify or change things based on your diet .but if your like me and Gluten intolerant and have a strict diet like I do you will appreciate this cookbook and all of Danielles cookbooks .I would love to see her get a show on Food Network it would really be a hit I think Thanks so much
customer_reviews.author: Shawn P Forsting

customer_reviews.title: A well-rounded selection of recipes, well presented
customer_reviews.text: I have long relied on Danielle's first book and blog for SCD baked goods but as I am a fairly accomplished home cook for stuff other than baking, I did not plan to prioritize buying this book. I purchased it on a whim because the price was so good, and wow.... am I glad I did. So many things I want to try, and some ideas for tweaks to dishes I already felt like I had mastered. It is beautifully photographed and well laid out and honestly now one of the top volumes in my cookbook library.
customer_reviews.author: DF

customer_reviews.title: ♥️
customer_reviews.text: I have the three other books by Danielle. I will say I do not need to follow a special diet, but I like to be challenged by making new recipes for my family. Many recipes in this book are delicious and easy to create (compared to her previous books...even Meals Made Simple!).
customer_reviews.author: LBaum

customer_reviews.title: Love love love
customer_reviews.text: All of her books are amazing!! And they’re sO helpful bc she has all the basic paleo & substitution info in each book, and my all time fav thing about her books is the PHOTO INDEX!! I can’t tell you how awesome it is to just go there and look at pictures to decide what to make. I wish all books did that! She even does meal plans and grocery lists. Her whole layout is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Tim K.

customer_reviews.title: It is a game changer!
customer_reviews.text: I have had digestive issues my whole life! I was recently diagnosed with type 2 diabetes, some pretty severe digestive issues, gluten sentivity and wheat intolerance. I ordered this book, it is amazing. Made several items, but must confess the “cream” of mushroom soup is a game changer! I am now a follower and own this cookbook and celebrations. Cooking through the books/recipes one at a time. Totally recommend this cookbook!
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra Ryan

customer_reviews.title: These cookbooks will change your life, especially if you have dietary concerns.
customer_reviews.text: This cookbook, and all of Danielle’s cookbooks, have helped to change my world. I’m dairy free and gluten free due to health concerns and through this cookbook (and her addition of several but free recipes, I’m allergic to almonds) has made cooking so much easier, and it is all delicious. I’ve purchased every one of her cookbooks and stalked her blog for years now and if you haven’t tried any of her recipes that she’s worked so hard to figure out, there is something wrong with you. The chance to eat dumplings that aren’t just made with “generic gluten free flour” is a game changer especially.
customer_reviews.author: BookishandBliss

product_meta.title: Danielle Walker's Eat What You Love: Everyday Comfort Food You Crave; Gluten-Free, Dairy-Free, and Paleo Recipes [A Cookbook]
